sentences.english: Lonnie listened to the grunting of the pigs as they walked up the driveway towards the big house.
sentences.chinese: 當他們在車道上朝大房子走時，朗尼聽着豬的哼聲。

sentences.english: If it sounds ho-hum to you , it will to others too .
sentences.chinese: 如果它聽起來浩哼聲這對於你們來說，將他人太。

sentences.english: The hoarse grunt or squeal is characteristic of toxicity.
sentences.chinese: 嘶啞的哼聲和叫聲是中毒的特徵。

sentences.english: Down below, the mare paced the small enclosure and snorted nervously.
sentences.chinese: 母馬在下面的圍場裏踱步併發出緊張的哼聲。

sentences.english: I like the way female tennis players grunt everytime they hit the ball.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡女子網球選手擊球時發出哼聲。

definition: see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to whisper to one another's ear
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
extraordinary strength/super strong/strong as an ox
horizontal bar to hold a door closed (made of wood or metal)/door bolt
to walk right into the trap
strong in appearance but weak in reality (idiom)
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
just a word or two (idiom); a few isolated phrases
